title: TLCTC v2.0 — Agentic AI Irreversibility Matrix
description: Reference data mapping consequence types to their irreversibility windows and recovery feasibility. The irreversibility window is the time between a consequence event and the point at which it becomes permanent. This is the most critical parameter for consequence-side control design: if the agent's consequence velocity exceeds the irreversibility window, prevention-heavy architectures are the only viable strategy.

metadata.source_paper: The Consequence Amplifier — Agentic AI on the Right Side of the Bow-Tie, §8
metadata.author: Bernhard Kreinz
metadata.registry_type: Layer 2 — Reference Registry extension for consequence-side analysis

core_principle: When the velocity of consequence generation exceeds the irreversibility window, consequence-side detection and response are structurally too late. The only effective control is to bound the consequence space BEFORE compromise occurs (cause-side capability restriction + consequence-side limitation controls).

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Once data is copied to an attacker-controlled location, confidentiality is permanently lost. The data cannot be 'unread' or 'unexposed'.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Breach notification, regulatory compliance, credential rotation (if credentials were exposed), monitoring for secondary abuse of exfiltrated data.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Agent reads and exfiltrates data via designed API integrations in seconds.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention-heavy. Blast-radius caps on data access volume. Classification-aware access gates. Rate limits per API.

irreversibility_matrix.irreversibility_window: Until backup cycle or journal checkpoint
irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Modifications can be reversed IF transaction journals exist and are checked before the next backup overwrites the pre-modification state.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Transaction journal replay, point-in-time restore, integrity comparison against known-good state.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Agent executes bulk modifications via designed database APIs in seconds.
irreversibility_matrix.velocity_note: Window depends on journal/backup configuration. Sub-minute journal checkpoints preserve recovery capability. Hourly backups create a gap where VC-4 modifications may be unrecoverable.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Balanced. Transaction journaling (sub-minute intervals). Modification rate limits. Integrity monitoring.

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Email delivery is near-instant. Message recall features exist but are unreliable (recipient may have already read, forwarded, or archived the message).
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Attempted message recall (low success rate). Follow-up correction communication. Reputational damage response. Legal assessment.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Agent sends hundreds of messages per second via designed email/messaging APIs.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention-heavy. Outbound message rate caps. Delayed sending queues (impose artificial VC-2 window). New-recipient approval gates. Content scanning before send.

irreversibility_matrix.irreversibility_window: Minutes to hours (varies by payment type)
irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Instant payment systems: zero window. Standard wire transfers: limited recall window (hours, success not guaranteed). Card transactions: chargeback possible within days but not guaranteed. Cryptocurrency: zero window.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Transaction reversal (within settlement window only). Bank coordination for wire recall. Chargeback initiation. Insurance claim. Law enforcement notification.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Financial APIs are designed for speed.
irreversibility_matrix.velocity_note: For instant payment systems, velocity always exceeds window. For wire transfers, there is a narrow window where detection may enable reversal.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention-heavy. Per-transaction value caps. Aggregate daily caps. Human approval gates above threshold. New-payee verification.

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Configuration changes propagate to dependent services in seconds. DNS changes: immediate but TTL-cached. Certificate revocation: immediate. Container scaling: seconds. Network rules: immediate.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Configuration rollback (requires knowing correct prior state). Service restart. DNS re-propagation (delayed by TTL caching). New certificate issuance and deployment.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4 for modification. Recovery is VC-1 to VC-2 (hours to days).
irreversibility_matrix.velocity_note: The asymmetry between destruction velocity (VC-4) and recovery velocity (VC-1/VC-2) is the core operational challenge. Damage takes seconds; recovery takes hours.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Balanced. Infrastructure change approval gates. Configuration drift detection. Automated rollback triggers. State snapshots at sub-minute intervals.

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: If backups exist and are not also deleted/corrupted: recoverable. If no backups exist or agent also modifies backup systems: permanent loss.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Restore from backup. Verify backup integrity (agent may have modified backups before deleting primary data). Forensic analysis of deletion sequence.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Bulk deletion via designed APIs.
irreversibility_matrix.velocity_note: Recovery is feasible IF backups are immutable and inaccessible to the agent. This is an architectural control that must be in place before compromise.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention + Recovery. Immutable backups (not accessible to agent). Deletion rate limits. Soft-delete with retention periods. Backup integrity monitoring.

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Public content is immediately cached, indexed, archived, and potentially copied by third parties. Web archives, search engine caches, social media screenshots, and news aggregators preserve published content indefinitely.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Content takedown request (slow, unreliable). Public correction statement. Reputational damage response. Legal assessment.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Agent publishes via designed CMS/social media APIs instantly.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention-heavy. Publication approval gates. Content staging with human review. CMS write-access restrictions. No direct social media API access for agents.

irreversibility_matrix.window_explanation: Once credentials are exposed (exfiltrated, logged in plaintext, transmitted to external endpoint), they must be assumed compromised regardless of whether the attacker has actually used them.
irreversibility_matrix.recovery_actions: Immediate credential rotation. Session invalidation. Review of all actions performed with exposed credentials. Monitoring for credential reuse.
irreversibility_matrix.agentic_velocity: VC-4. Agent reads credential stores and secrets management systems via designed APIs.
irreversibility_matrix.control_strategy: Prevention-heavy. Agent must not have access to credential stores or secrets management systems. Principle of least privilege: agent uses scoped, short-lived tokens only.
irreversibility_matrix.cause_side_note: Per Axiom X (Credential Duality): credential acquisition maps to the enabling cluster. If the agent reads credentials from a secrets store using its designed access (#1 function abuse), the acquisition is a consequence of #1. If those credentials are subsequently used, the use is ALWAYS #4 (R-CRED).

usage_guidance.c_suite_question: What is the maximum damage this agent can do in its first 60 seconds after compromise, before any detection or containment is possible?
assessment_procedure: 1. For each tool category the agent can access, identify the applicable irreversibility entries above
2. For each entry where velocity_exceeds_window is true, calculate the maximum consequence volume at VC-4 speed
3. Sum the irreversible consequences across all tool categories — this is the '60-second damage number'
4. If that number exceeds risk appetite: reduce blast-radius caps and capability restrictions until it doesn't
5. For entries where velocity_exceeds_window is false: verify that recovery mechanisms (backups, journals, rollback) are functional and tested
usage_guidance.architectural_principle: If 60 seconds of unconstrained agent operation produces unacceptable irreversible damage, the answer is not better detection. The answer is smaller blast-radius caps and tighter capability restrictions.
